results.headline: Review: ‘Truth’ Treads a Perilous Political Tightrope
results.summary_short: “Truth,” starring Cate Blanchett and Robert Redford, looks back at a “60 Minutes II” report and its fallout.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Truth

results.headline: Review: In ‘Experimenter,’ Are They Following Orders or Instincts?
results.summary_short: In the intellectually playful portrait of the social psychologist Stanley Milgram, the director, Michael Almereyda, turns a biopic into a mind game.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Experimenter

results.headline: Review: ‘Field Niggas’ Is a Meditation on Life on the Streets of East Harlem
results.summary_short: The director Khalik Allah shows people existing in a form of bondage, often created by drug addiction, but he manages to find radiance as well.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Field Niggas

results.headline: Review: ‘The Boy From Geita,’ a Harrowing Tale of Albino Persecutions
results.summary_short: Vic Sarin’s documentary chronicles vicious attacks against people born with albinism in rural Tanzania.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Boy From Geita

results.headline: Review: ‘The Assassin’ Finds Delight in a Deadly Vocation
results.summary_short: This stately and graceful action movie from the director Hou Hsiao-Hsien is intriguing but ultimately opaque.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Assassin

results.headline: Review: ‘Tab Hunter Confidential,’ About a Heartthrob
results.summary_short: Jeffrey Schwarz’s documentary charts the rise and fall of a onetime screen pretty boy.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Tab Hunter Confidential

results.headline: Review: ‘Room,’ Mother and Child in 100 Square Feet
results.summary_short: Emma Donoghue adapts her acclaimed novel of captivity for the screen, with Brie Larson and Jacob Tremblay starring.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Room

results.headline: Review: ‘Mi America,’ on the Murder of Migrant Laborers in a Small Town
results.summary_short: This crime drama was written and directed by Robert Fontaine, who plays a detective in an economically distressed town with decades of wounds.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Mi America

results.headline: Review: ‘Meadowland,’ a Missing-Child Story Centered on the Parents
results.summary_short: Directed by Reed Morano, this drama stars Olivia Wilde and Luke Wilson as a couple whose young son disappears during a family trip.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Meadowland

results.headline: Review: ‘Homemakers,’ an Ode to the Do-It-Yourself Ethos
results.summary_short: This jagged-edged indie from Colin Healey is about a wild-child drama queen who moves to Pittsburgh to renovate a house her grandfather has left her.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Homemakers

results.headline: Review: ‘Goosebumps’ Brings R.L. Stine’s Monsters to Life
results.summary_short: The bulk of this movie is a jam-packed pop-up book in the form of computer-generated imagery.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Goosebumps

results.headline: Review: ‘Beasts of No Nation,’ a Brutal Tale of Child Soldiers in Africa
results.summary_short: In this film, written and directed by Cary Joji Fukunaga, the line between innocence and evil is thinner than the blade of a machete.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Beasts of No Nation

results.headline: Review: ‘All Things Must Pass’ Tells Story of Tower Records
results.summary_short: This documentary tracks the rise and fall of the Tower franchise and notes its influence on some of the biggest names in music.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of All Things Must Pass

results.headline: ‘Crimson Peak,’ a Guillermo del Toro Gothic Romance in High Bloody Style
results.summary_short: The horror and sci-fi specialist Guillermo del Toro explores a genre that has receded in recent years, adding gore, ghosts and smatterings of Henry James.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Crimson Peak

results.headline: Review: ‘A Ballerina’s Tale’ Chronicles the Rise of Misty Copeland
results.summary_short: Nelson George’s documentary delves into the talent and drive — and the career-threatening injuries — of American Ballet Theater’s first black female principal dancer.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of A Ballerina's Tale

results.headline: Review: In ‘Xenia,’ a Fraternal Bond and a Quest
results.summary_short: Panos H. Koutras’s exuberant road movie about two brothers, one straight and one flamboyantly gay, begins just after the death of their mother.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Xenia

results.headline: Review: ‘Victoria,’ a Nonstop Flight Through the Streets of Berlin
results.summary_short: Directed by Sebastian Schipper and filmed in one continuous take, this thriller tracks a young woman as she gets involved in an early-morning heist.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Victoria

results.headline: Review: ‘The Final Girls’ Looks Over Its Shoulder at Horror Tropes
results.summary_short: This movie proves that with the right actors you can make an amusing movie even if a lot of the ideas are borrowed.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Final Girls

results.headline: Review: ‘Steve Jobs,’ Apple’s Visionary C.E.O. Dissected
results.summary_short: The movie burnishes the image of Apple’s co-founder even as it tries to peek behind the curtain at the gimcrack machinery of omnipotence.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Steve Jobs

results.headline: Review: ‘In My Father’s House,’ a Rapper Reconnects With Dad
results.summary_short: This documentary by Ricki Stern and Annie Sundberg follows Che Smith, a.k.a. Rhymefest, as he finds the man who abandoned him 25 years before.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of In My Father's House
